instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3436: What is 820-3436? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - boot hang intermittent
threads.message:
pass ASD EFI and Memtest. sometimes it just stops 1/3 of the loading bar.

found corrosion on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and corroded pin 10 and pin6. I've replaced this chip and fixed the trace. 

i also have tried other bios with clean me and its still same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - boot hang intermittent
threads.message:
3436 for sure?
I suppose it is 3435.

Did you try external OSX?
Also try the MLB alone, without LIO board connected, nor even TP/KB, or battery; use external monitor and USB TP/KB.
Did you clean ME with Medusa?
I hope you didn't try with vinafix BIOS file...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - boot hang intermittent
threads.message:
opss sorry, its <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

yes with an external drive and took the board out and put in a known working chassis.

i used this one by duke. i used on other boards before and works fine.
[URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/37967-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-not-loading-installing-osx"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/for...installing-osx[/URL]


ok i'll test with board only.



btw any luck with bios for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - boot hang intermittent
threads.message:
just tried:
[LIST]
[*]MLB with LCD cable, USB drive, with battery
[*]MLB with LCD cable, USB drive with DC plug without i/o flex cable.
[/LIST]
same results.


i guess the board probably have a bad CPU solder joint.
